sourcesContent:
import React from 'react' import { Card, CardContent, Typography } from '@material-ui/core'; export default function aboutMeCard() { return ( About Me

Hi, my name is Ricky and I'm 22 years old. I am a recent graduate from Texas Chrisitian University where I studied mechanical engineering. Undertaking an engineering disciple allowed me to explore my interests in the fields of math and science and develop my technical and analytical thinking skills. Towards the end of my college career, I began to develop a keen interest in computer programming and software development. Upon graduation, I siezed an opportunity to spend 3 months in Bangalore, India working with an oversees software development team. The comapny was in the later stages of start-up development and they needed me to work with both frontend and backend web frameworks while in a new, fast-paced and challenging environment. With no previous familiarity with the frontend and backend frameworks they were using, I was eager to accept the challenge of learning through struggle and persistence.

After months of programming with the team I am extremely please with the skills and knowledge that I have aquired during my time there. I have learned that it's all about seeing struggle and failure as a catalyst for growth. It's about undertaking challenges with the intention of testing and pushing your limits so that you can become more than you are now. It's about being calm in the face of stress and being increasingly persistent when things seem to be going against you. The mantra was: Dont give up..take a breathe..come at it from a different angle, a different point of view. Indeed, many of the lessons I have learned during my months of programming and struggle have practical applications in everyday life.

I am a strong believer that you need to assimilate and implement new ideas, new goals, new teachings and new interests consistenly and willyfully in order to fully expereince and grasp the depth of them. After my college graduation, I knew it was time to challenge myself and throw myself into a completely new enviroment to test myself and see just what I'm made of. This desire has been partially satisfied by these last few months in India. I say partially because I am just getting started on my journey of facing challenges and failure and then ultimately learning and growing. I am begining to see it as a very circular process than never ends as long as there is peristence, motivation and passion. I am constantly searching for new experinces and environements that will allow me to push myself to reach my fullest potential and be of maximum service to others. I am a muti-passionate individual with a variety of different interests and hoobies and I hope that you can catch a glimpse of that while exploring my webpage!

 ) }
